title.value: About a new tomato disease in protected ground in Belarus
О новом для Беларуси заболевании томата защищённого грунта

journal.title: Agriculture and Plant Protection : scientific-practical journal

person.name: Vabishchevich, V.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute of Plant Protection

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus the literary data on biology and harmfulness of Pepino Mosaic Virus that widely distributed on tomato (Lycopersicon esculentum) plants in Europe are presented. There are shown materials of immunosorbent assay of tomato plant samples Geronimo F1, grown in greenhouse, confirming the presence of the virus in the country submitted. Currently the Pepino Mosaic Virus infects tomato grown in protected soil conditions in many European countries. The pathogen has an ability to transmit seeds by insect pollinators (bees) and a contact has a rapid spread of the virus inside the greenhouse, and beyond. Strain composition of the agent determines the level of harmfulness and economic damage caused by the virus infected tomato crop. Detection of the VMPep in greenhouses of the republic entails the risk of its spread throughout the territory and determines the relevance of monitoring the appearance of the pathogen in the greenhouses.
